author: Ja Kub
comment: Great app, do what it should, but there is Stocard

author: Mike Rockland
comment: A few weeks after I purchased this app, my watch upgraded to Android Wear 2.0 and since then the app no longer works at all. It does not appear on the app list on the watch. I contacted CodeChimp to tell them, and they never responded to my email.  ----------------------------------------------------- Update after CodeChimps reply to this review.  I re-installed the app, and it now works on my watch with Android Wear 2.0

reply.author: CodeChimp
reply.content: Hi Mike, i didn't receive an email from you and reply to all enquiries I receive.  A version that's compatible with wear 2 was released last week.  Please try uninstalling and reinstall, it should now prompt to install the wear version when you open the phone app.  Any difficulty please email me.

author: Carl Petrou
comment: Best Android Wear App I've come across.   No more getting my phone out when I'm jumping on a plane, train or even when I'm pickup my coffee from Starbucks.   This is the awesome power of Android Wear!

author: Wai Hung Wong
comment: The codes displayed on my Watch Sport with a high ppi screen are way too small to read. They are just surrounded by a lot of white space.

author: Konstantinos Kakosimos
comment: Huawei Watch 2: QR code can only be pushed to watch from phone, not retrievable from watch, and way too small

author: Albert Phan
comment: Couldn't pick up QR code for my American airlines boarding pass.

author: Ike Dimitriadis
comment: Required payment for the premium version after adding one code.

author: eric roberts
comment: does not support Huawei watch

author: Jacob Crow
comment: This app is awesome

author: Valerii Vyshniak
comment: But default name for all boarding passes is same (name of flight company). So on watches i can't recognize what code to show and not possible to check more info. The name should be passenger name + flight direction. PS: I am adding .pkpass files from gmail (tap on pkpass attachment, then open in this app), so all of this information is available in "data" field.

reply.author: CodeChimp
reply.content: For PKPass the organization name and description fields are combined, which should contain the flight details though it seems your airline does not.  The "data" field is purely a code for the barcode so I can only suggest editing the title manually after import.

title: Good

author: John Preston
comment: I found out that you have to manually install the app from the watch in wear 2.0... So it works .. but the high res of the LG sport screen makes the image small - does not fill the screen

reply.author: CodeChimp
reply.content: Thanks for the update, once I have a wear 2 device I'll try to improve this.

comment: 1. Should be able to create and delete QR codes from tasker, not only show them.  2. The code shown on the watch could be bigger as I found it hard for some readers to read it.

reply.author: CodeChimp
reply.content:
Thanks for the useful suggestions, I'll consider extending tasker support in future.
The barcode display is as large as it can be with the way different watches report their dimensions, so there's little I can do about increasing the size.

title: Very nice app. But..

author: Larry Allingham
comment: Great app. Notification by card doesn't work for me on AW2.0 (DP4). The card just displays the name of the code, not the code itself :(

reply.author: CodeChimp
reply.content: An update was released today to work with Wear 2 fixing this issue.

author: Drew Watkins
comment: Really excited about the potential for such an app, though didn't work with my SWA boarding pass. When manually importing from a saved image, I received a "decode error". Additionally, having both sides of the cropping rectangle move towards the center at the same time was awkward and required me moving the rectangle several times to align the box with the barcode on the far right of the saved image.

reply.author: CodeChimp
reply.content: Thanks for the feedback, unfortunately not all codes are recognised via the image importer.  The cropping function I will be improving in a future release.

title: Importing Errors

author: Yazz Atlas
comment: The only reason I don't give it 5 stars is WiFi entries are hidden text. There shouldn't be a reason I can't view and edit the keys. Not everyone has a barcode reader on their phone. Making it much more difficult to share WiFi passwords.

reply.author: CodeChimp
reply.content: The latest update to Wear Codes now allows you to show/hide the WiFi password.

title: Over 20 items stored and works great.

author: paul houle
comment: I used this with Southwest Airlines in the USA and it worked flawlessly. I saved my boarding pass as a picture to my phone and cropped it. Word of caution... make sure you leave a white border when you crop the QR code within your phone's editing app. If you don't leave any room the Wear Codes app won't have enough room to properly capture your code. Obviously no guarantees but it worked great for me!
title: Worked Perfectly!

author: Onik Russinov
comment: I was so happy when I was able to successfully scan my United boarding pass at newark when boarding, instead of tumbling with a flimsy piece of paper. All I had to do was scan the bp with my phone, and the watch immediately had the qr code available to the screen. The app warned me not all into could be saved as there was too much info on the bp, but it worked anyways. It scanned perfectly, in fact far better than when I've tried with my phone through the actual United app. 👍👏👍👏👍😃
title: Wonderful

author: stephen loynd
comment: Works well! Worth paying for!
title: Great app

author: Martijn Bakker
comment: Perfect

author: Peter W
comment: Due to interference with glass, backlights and polarized screens this app will not work in any store that uses laser scanners and nearly all do. Try it if you like, but don't pay for it or you will find out the hard way like I did.

reply.author: CodeChimp
reply.content: All watch apps are very dependent on the type of scanners used in stores but it works for many.  Please contact me if you would like a refund.

title: This app cannot work with LCD screens and laser scanners.

author: ian Ledger
comment: I put several codes onto my watch but not one of them works. Most scanners do not recognise the code on the screen. Uninstalling
title: Codes cannot be scanned

author: Christiaan de Die
comment: 1 barcode is the limit for free. Else you need to pay more. QuickBar is a better alternative
title: Doesn't report 1 barcode limit

author: M M
comment: 1 free code and even that is not easy to create.
title: Don't bother

author: Todd Eisenberg
comment: One Dunkin' card seemed to produce a different QR code, switched cards and it seems good now.   ***Update, support is great if needed! Great App!***

author: Michael Ryder
comment: Great app

reply.author: CodeChimp
reply.content: Thanks for the review, QR codes are broken down into the friendly names of Card, Ticket, Text etc.

author: Nigel Tomkins
comment: Nice design, great function.
title: Excellent

author: Dan Fontana
comment: I use it to pay for my Dunkin Donuts:)
title: Awesome

author: Simon Brander
comment: Works like a charm

author: bobby gibbs
comment: I love having so my loyalty cards and my gym membership just on my watch but I would like too see a location based notification system you that as you walk into a store it notifies you to use it and and to use the notification as a shortcut to the barcode. Edit, I discovered that you could use with tasker to trigger notification based events great addition
title: Love the app

author: Shadi Shalabi
comment: I couldn't test properly wih different cards and one code. Would pay 99 cents but not more.
title: Interesting but one code only?

author: Chantale Haineault
comment: So much fun watching people just look at me at Starbucks!!!... BUT only 1 barcode for free. I'm ready to pay 1$ to upgrade not more.
title: Too much fun!!!

author: Jagdeep Nagpal
comment: Excellent app but can you please include barcode image import as well. Many apps have barcode displayed and I can't scan my own phone. So importing barcode from screenshot would be very useful. Thanks.  Edited. Does everything

reply.author: CodeChimp
reply.content: You can import barcode images, just share the image from any app.  For screenshots you will have to crop the image.  Please refer to the help page in the app for more details.

title: Excellent but...

author: Andrew Majewski
comment: Great application. Always a Wow effect at the airport at check-in.
title: Wow

author: Francisco Perez jr
comment: Nice app but you need to pay if you want to add more than one.
title: Only one card allowed.

author: Austin Colhouer
comment: I paid for the full version of this app and now it won't show up on my moto 360 anymore. If you use this with android wear dont bother paying for it (UPDATE) Works fine now back to 5 stars. Thanks for the help

reply.author: CodeChimp
reply.content: If the app isn't showing please try Resync apps from the Google Android Wear app.  If the list of codes isn't showing then try the Resync option within Wear Codes settings.  If this still doesn't work please contact me at android@codechimp.org and I'll try to help.

title: Dosent work

author: Georg R.
comment: I have no issues with paying for a good app, but if you offer a free version for testing then this needs to support more than one code initially.
title: One contact only?

author: Paul Konen
comment: And to charge $2.50 for more codes.  Maybe just what everyone else does and charge $0.99.
title: Only one code?

author: Travis Imel
comment: It really makes people take a second look when they have to scan my watch while out shopping lol.
title: Haha

author: Mustafa Hashmi
comment: Developer added caching in a short time after I requested the feature.

reply.author: CodeChimp
reply.content: Watch caching has just been released, you should get the update shortly.

title: Perfect app worth every penny.

author: Manny Castillo
comment: This is a convenient app to have. Used with Tasker it is very easy to automate the use of it. Regarding security I received this information from the developer: The codes are stored in a secure data area specific to the app.  If your phone is not rooted then it's protected.  If you have a rooted phone then other apps can access this area and could read the codes.  If you make a backup then this file sits on the root folder available for anything to read so I'd advise moving it to a cloud store or similar."
title: Great app! Convenient
